intro: Sonchus engleri, commonly known as the Chinese sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with alternate, lobed leaves that are often hairy. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters, and it is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and fields. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is considered a weed in many regions.
